nio/Buffer.description: Collects all incoming signals and then emits them every **interval**. If **interval_duration** is non-zero, then the signal emitted each **interval** will be all the signals over the last **interval_duration**, not just since the last emit. If **use_persistence** is *True*, then persistence is used to maintain the list of signals between stopping and starting the block.

backup_interval.title: Backup Interval
backup_interval.description: Interval to backup buffer to persistence

group_by.title: Group By
group_by.description: Specify signal attribute to group incoming signals by

interval.title: Buffer Interval
interval.description: Time interval at which signals are emitted.

interval_duration.title: Interval Duration
interval_duration.description: Each *interval* signals will emit going back this amount of time. If unspecifed or 0, then all input signals over the last **interval** will be emitted.

load_from_persistence.title: Load from Persistence?
load_from_persistence.description: If *True*, use persistence to store the list of signals.

signal_start.title: Start Interval On Signal?
signal_start.description: Start the interval when a signal is received

default.description: Stored signals going back for the amount of time specified by the configured interval
